channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Saarland University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Efficient Streaming Algorithms for Graphlet Sampling
item.description: STREAM-UGS: a novel semi-streaming algorithm for efficient graphlet sampling, enabling fast analysis of massive graphs with limited memory.

item.title: InversionView: A General-Purpose Method for Reading Information from Neural Activations
item.description: InversionView unveils neural network inner workings by decoding information from activations. It identifies inputs producing similar activations, revealing the information content. Case studies on v…

item.title: On the Complexity of Identification in Linear Structural Causal Models
item.description: New polynomial-space algorithm for causal parameter identification in linear models vastly improves upon existing methods, showing that this crucial task is computationally hard.

item.title: Stabilized Proximal-Point Methods for Federated Optimization
item.description: S-DANE & ACC-S-DANE achieve best-known communication complexity for federated learning, improving local computation efficiency via stabilized proximal-point methods.

item.title: The Expressive Capacity of State Space Models: A Formal Language Perspective
item.description: State-space models (SSMs) rival transformers in language modeling, but their capabilities remain unclear; this paper rigorously analyzes SSM expressivity, revealing unique strengths and limitations, i…
